title: Teen shot at Parkland bus stop
content:
LOUISVILLE, Ky. —
A 17-year-old is recovering at University Hospital after being shot multiple times.
Police responded to the 1300 block of Cypress Street around 6 p.m. Wednesday. The victim told police he was waiting for a bus when a man dressed in dark clothing cut through an alley and began firing.
Neighbors in the Parkland area reported hearing about five shots.
Sheron Duncan lives nearby and told WLKY she was devastated to learn the city's latest victim of gun violence was a teen.
"I'm sure he's been to school today. Who knows the circumstances or why this happened but it's unfortunate it happened. I'm sorry for the family. I'm so sorry it happened, I really am," Duncan said.
The victim, who was alert and talking when he was transported to the hospital, is expected to survive.
So far, police have not named any suspects. Anyone with information on the shooting is asked to call the anonymous police tipline at 574-LMPD.
